The Apostle now enters upon a particular and domestic 'exhortatiom And since, as Aristotle has rightly observed, Polit· i. 3, there are three alliances (or moral relations) (ff which every house is composed, of which the husband and. wife constitute the first; the parents and children, the se- cond 3 the master and servants, the third: the Apostle as- signs precepts to all these; but he begins with the nuptial state, as the first and most worthy.
